name: Anpanman Niko Niko Party
overview: Anpanman Niko Niko Party (麵包超人 微笑派對(日)) (aka "Breadman Super Smile Party") is an adaptation game of the classic "Bread Superman" which was extended in 1973 after the debut of the picture book and later adapted to TV animation. The game was recorded by the original voice actor of TV animation. Debut characters, as well as familiar topics / insert songs. The game uses the celluloid 3D drawing method to faithfully present the original images and movements of the animation. It contains a variety of ingenious and easy-to-understand games. It provides dynamic and somatosensory operation through the Wii Remote, and supports up to 3 players.
